title: I.Sicily inscription 000392
support: Fragment of a marble plaque, inserted in modern times into plaster, obscuring the rear and true thickness of the fragment. Lower edge may be original, broken on the other sides.

layout.p: Three lines of Latin letters preserved, of decreasing size.

handNote.lettering: Triangular interpunct in line three. Brown paint in the letters.

date._: 1st century CE or early 2nd century CE (K)

provenanceFound._: Seen by Carrara in 1639, said to be in a house near the Collegio de Padri Gesuiti, Catania

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana (Photo by students of Liceo Lazzaro, 2017)

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
